channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New York has a new Archbishop. His background looks a lot like Pope Leo's
item.description: Like Pope Leo, Bishop Ronald Hicks is an Illinois native with deep experience in Latin America.

item.title: What to know about Jared Isaacman, the billionaire private astronaut leading NASA
item.description: Trump withdrew Isaacman's nomination in May, citing the billionaire's donations to Democrats and ties to Elon Musk. He was renominated last month and ...

item.title: Mangione pre-trial hearing wraps, but judge won't rule on evidence for months
item.description: After three weeks of testimony, a judge will now rule on whether evidence found in Mangione's backpack can be used in his state trial for the murder o...

item.title: Austrian nuns await word from the Vatican on whether they can stay in their convent
item.description: The three octogenarian nuns broke out of a nursing home to go back to live in their convent, sparking a dispute with their church superior. Both sides...

item.title: Inflation cools slightly in November as worries about affordability grip Americans
item.description: The cost of living in November was up 2.7% from a year ago, according to a report Thursday from the Labor Department. That's a smaller annual increase...

item.title: Tren de Aragua leader known as "The Unspeakable" charged in U.S. federal court
item.description: Federal prosecutors allege Hector Rusthenford Guerrero, 42, grew Tren de Aragua from a prison gang to a global crime syndicate.

item.title: Multiple deaths reported in North Carolina crash of business jet connected to retired NASCAR driver
"Fraud tourists" went to Minnesota to make money off state programs, prosecutors say
item.description: Federal prosecutors announced new indictments Thursday in the widening Minnesota fraud scandal, this time involving two Philadelphia-based men accused...

item.title: Witness describes Greg Biffle plane crash
item.description: Retired NASCAR driver Greg Biffle, his wife Cristina and their kids were killed in a plane crash Thursday in North Carolina. CBS News correspondent Cr...

item.title: Ex-Nascar driver and family believed to be among seven killed in US aircrash
item.description: Officials confirm racer Greg Biffle was among those who boarded the small aircraft that crashed at a regional airport in North Carolina.

item.title: Police are investigating link between Brown shooting and killing of MIT professor, AP sources say
item.description: Authorities are investigating a connection between the mass hooting at Brown University and the killing of an MIT professor two days later.

item.title: Wiz Khalifa sentenced to nine months jail in Romania for smoking cannabis on stage
item.description: The rapper, who has been sentenced in absentia, had admitted to smoking a cannabis joint on stage at a festival last year.

item.title: HR exec in viral Coldplay clip speaks of abuse, threats and trying to find a new job
item.description: Kristin Cabot says she was bombarded with abusive and threatening messages after being filmed with her boss on the 'kiss-cam'.

item.title: Trump expands access to cannabis in a major shift in drug policy
item.description: The order to place cannabis in the same category as Tylenol with codeine marks the most significant change in US drug policy since 1971.

item.title: 11/13: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: House to vote on Epstein files next week as White House tells GOP "don't be fooled" over email release; New book explores Russia's short-lived victory...

item.title: Violence breaks out in Bangladesh after death of youth protest leader
item.description: Sharif Osman Hadi was a prominent figure in the movement that ousted former prime minister Sheik Hasina.

item.title: Retired NASCAR driver Greg Biffle and wife, kids among 7 killed in plane crash, officials say
item.description: Seven passengers aboard a business jet that crashed Thursday at a regional airport in North Carolina have died, the State Highway Patrol said.

item.title: Brian Walshe is sentenced to life in prison for the murder of his wife, whose body was never found
